Title.evidence: Utilization of Optimal Medical Therapy in Chronic Limb Threatening Ischemia: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation was conducted at the patient level.

Participants.evidence: Participants were patients with CLTI enrolled across multiple centers. Eligibility criteria included diagnosis of CLTI.

Objective.evidence: assesses the utilization of guideline-based optimal medical therapy (OMT) at trial enrollment.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the proportion of patients meeting OMT criteria at baseline.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted at the patient level.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 1830 patients were randomised.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Only 25% met all four OMT criteria, while 38% met three, 24% met two, 11% met one, and 2% met none.
